नवनाथ (Navnath) refers to the nine gods or deities worshiped in Hinduism, particularly in the state of Maharashtra. These gods are considered to be the manifestations of the ultimate god, Brahma. The nine Navnaths are:

1. Lord Shiva - The destroyer of evil and ignorance.
2. Lord Vishnu - The preserver of the universe and the protector of all living beings.
3. Lord Ganesha - The remover of obstacles and the lord of knowledge.
4. Goddess Parvati - The consort of Lord Shiva and the goddess of fertility and motherhood.
5. Lord Kartikeya - The god of war and the son of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati.
6. Goddess Laxmi - The goddess of wealth and prosperity.
7. Lord Hanuman - The monkey god and the embodiment of devotion and loyalty.
8. Goddess Saraswati - The goddess of knowledge, music, and the arts.
9. Lord Nag Devata - The god of serpents and the protector of the universe.

Each of these Navnaths has its own unique powers and qualities, and they are revered in different parts of Maharashtra. The Navnath Sampraday, a religious tradition that follows the teachings of these gods, is an important part of Marathi culture and is practiced by many people in Maharashtra.
